title: Penalty for false evidence
context: §40-95 Penalty for false evidence. If any person, in the course of the person&rsquo;s examination before the comptroller, wilfully and corruptly gives false evidence, the person so offending shall incur the same penalties as are or may be provided against persons convicted of perjury. [L 1898, c 39, §35; RL 1925, §1440; RL 1935, §567; RL 1945, §1571; RL 1955, §34-20; am L 1957, c 152, §1; HRS §40-95; gen ch 1985] Cross References Perjury, see §710-1060.
